It’s finally here.... the LAST DAY of what seems like our hardest year ever!!

A HUGE THANK YOU to all the parents, older brothers/sisters, aunts, uncles, grandparents, and neighbors who helped our kids with their virtual learning. We GREATLY appreciate everyone’s effort.

Also, I do not know what we would do without our amazing instructional staff. The teachers and aides delivered quality instruction without training or practice. They worked all hours of the day and night to provide all of our students with the best education possible!!

The school year is done..... but the work isn’t. LVDLCS admin and staff are working through the state’s guidelines for reopening next year. We will be sharing options and asking for feedback soon! Information about report cards, returning technology, and picking up any personal items from the school will follow as well.

Again..... THANK YOU EVERYONE FOR AN AMAZING YEAR!! It taught us all what we are truly capable of in times of adversity!!

THANK YOU to all students and staff for your awesome efforts during today’s fire alarm incident. You all did an amazing job following the expected rules and procedures... and being patient!

Parents, today at 2:30 the fire alarm went off and the building was evacuated. We were required to wait for the fire department to inspect the entire building (this was not an incident in our part of the building). Staff retrieved coats for the kids and everyone was safe throughout the evacuation. It is my understanding that a pipe coming into the building that feeds into the sprinkler system broke and set sprinklers off in another part of the building.... which activated the fire alarm.

Thank you to all of our parents who pick up their students for your flexibility and patience while we matched you all up at the main door.

It is days like this that make me so very proud to be an LVDLCS Eagle! #loveLVDLCS #eaglepride #proudprincipal
